intro: Pedicularis flexuosa var. longituba, commonly known as the long-tubed lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It is a member of the Orobanchaceae family, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its tubular corolla is adapted to attract specific pollinators, such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
